entries.content: Objections are not rejections; they are requests for more information.
entries.notes: Emphasizes reframing objections as opportunities to provide value.

entries.content: You have never lost a sale because you never had it until money is in your account.
entries.notes: Encourages detachment from premature emotional investment in deals.

entries.content: Ask 'when did we have it?' to reframe lost deals as unrealized opportunities.
entries.notes: A tactical question to maintain perspective on deal ownership.

entries.content: Prospects lie about price being the issue; they rely on salespeople being scared to say no.
entries.notes: Highlights the psychological game around pricing objections.

entries.content: If price is the only factor, we're out - we'll never be the cheapest.
Procurement exists to remove emotion from buying; circumvent it by talking to decision-makers directly.
entries.notes: Strategic approach to bypass procedural barriers.

entries.content: Go to the top - CEOs will hear you out even if others won't.
entries.notes: High-risk high-reward approach to dealing with objections.

entries.content: Stop letting prospects use you as a free information source; qualify their authority early.
entries.notes: Protects against time-wasters masquerading as prospects.

entries.content: Giving a demo without emotional engagement is like showing family photos uninvited.

focus_area: Objection Mindset: Objections = info requests, not rejections
